item.title: __libc_start_main usage
item.description: __libc_start_main usage Recently I am working on hacking user’s main function. The reason why I need to do this is that we are unable to change argv0 via ld.so. Basically, there are two ways if you want to use execve syscall. http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/execve.2.html Directy using execve with executable’s filename as the target (absolute path) and argv0(the first item in argv array) as the argument passed to “main” function. argv is an array of argument strings passed to the new program.
